main_text.sentence: These hypercoagulable abnormalities return towards normal with therapy in direct correlation with sedimentation rate and clinical disease activity [12], but can still show mild abnormalities despite clinical remission[14].

Proponents of neurodevelopmental models suggest that the premorbid cognitive abnormalities are developmental risk factors for future schizophrenia (c.f [23]) and argue that such abnormalities show little evidence of decline after onset [6,24].
